intro: Paraboea brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests. Paraboea brachycarpa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
